revised_title: On the Development and Succession of Poison-Fangs in Snakes
tldr: The authors studied the development and succession of poison-fangs in snakes, specifically focusing on the differences between viperine and colubrine poisonous snakes. They discovered that the poison-fangs in viperine snakes develop in two parallel series, while in colubrine snakes, they develop in a single series. The authors also examined the individual tooth-germ formation and the unique features of the poison-fang, such as the stellate reticulum and the fluted base.
